page.title: Interest Rate Differentials and Currency Carry Trades

overview.title: Overview
bullets: Interest-rate differentials are the gap between two economies’ rates; they influence FX trends and power carry trades.
A currency carry trade borrows a low-rate currency and holds a higher-rate currency to earn the spread.
Carry can be attractive in calm markets but is vulnerable to volatility and policy shifts.

items.label: Interest Rate Policies
items.text: Central banks adjust rates to manage inflation and growth. Divergent paths create carry opportunities.

items.label: Currency Valuation
items.text: Higher-rate currencies may attract capital and appreciate; low-rate funding currencies can drift lower.

items.label: Economic Indicators
items.text: Inflation, GDP, and employment steer expectations for policy, shaping the carry backdrop.

choose.title: 1. Choosing Currencies for Carry Trades
bullets: Borrow in a low-yield currency (e.g., JPY/CHF) and invest in a higher-yield currency (e.g., AUD/NZD).
The position seeks to earn the net interest (“carry”) on the higher-yield side.

earn.title: 2. Earning Interest Rate Differentials
bullets: Carry P/L comes from the spread between interest paid (funding) and interest earned (target).
Stable or widening spreads, plus favorable FX drift, can compound returns.

conditions.title: Market Conditions Favorable for Carry Trades

lowVol.title: 1. Low Market Volatility
bullets: Carry tends to work best when FX ranges are calm and tail risks are muted.
Quiet conditions let the rate spread dominate outcomes.

riskOn.title: 2. Risk-On Sentiment
bullets: In optimistic phases, investors are more willing to hold higher-yielding currencies.
Risk-on backdrops often align with stronger high-rate FX and supportive carry.

benefits.title: Benefits of Carry Trades
bullets: Additional income potential from the interest spread, even in range-bound markets.
Possible capital appreciation if the higher-rate currency strengthens.
Portfolio diversification relative to equity and bond exposures.

risks.title: Risks and Limitations of Carry Trades

items.label: Market Volatility
items.text: Sudden FX swings can overwhelm carry income and flip returns negative.

items.label: Currency Depreciation Risk
items.text: If the high-rate currency weakens materially, carry gains can be erased.

items.label: Policy Shifts
items.text: Unexpected central-bank actions can compress spreads and reverse trends abruptly.
